text:
A small park definitely built more for calisthenic enthusiasts with the prominent central fitness corner and some stationary cycling equipment, and a narrow jogging path that gingerly winds itself sharply around the equipment and u-turns at the edge of the slope overlooking Balestier Hill Estate.

Nothing kid-friendly here, with the tiled path unsuitable for the kid scooters or blades. If you're thinking of doing up-slope interval training, then as the park's name suggests, this could work.
Good shaded place with the trees. Only missing a shelter when it rains otherwise, nice chill place for a workout. Also only have 1 exit/entrance. Need some stairs down toward balestier Road.
Very small park. Great for calisthenics. There is a walk path that circles the park which can be used as a jogging path. But, I like the challenge of going up and down the steep hill.
Small but peaceful and green enough - away from the traffic.
Kudos to the park personnel for keeping everything clean and well-kept. During my visits, I've never come across any litter or unkempt areas.
